overview: This is a small chamber choir of 12–20 members that performs music of the middle ages, renaissance and baroque. The ensemble performs both a cappella and also in conjunction with other early music ensembles.
This subject is co-taught with MUSI10056 Early Voices 1 and MUSI30172 Early Voices 1. Students cannot simultaneously enrol in co-taught subjects in the same study period.

additional pre-requisite: AUDITION: Students are required to request an audition for this subject. Follow the link below to locate the relevant audition form.
This subject requires a successful audition outcome to enrol. A successful audition outcome may be used as proof of permission to enrol with the submission of an Enrolment Assistance form to Stop 1.

assessments.description: Regular in-class group assessment of part preparation. 800 words (equivalent)
Active participation in all rehearsals and performances as directed. 200 words (equivalent)
Hurdle requirement:. Students must attend 100% of all scheduled classes, rehearsals and performances as directed.

Semester 1.Contact hours: 24 hours, comprising one 2-hour rehearsal per week

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
